page.title: 07Fossils
page.content: The rocks of the area abound in the fossil remains of sea creatures which lived in the mud or round the reefs, and there are plenty of pieces in the quarries in the hills.The silurian period of rock building was first studied in this area over a hundred years ago. Names deriving from Leintwardine district were given to some species of fossil sea creatures. Such fossils are{Conchidium knighti} and {Monograptus leintwardinensis.} {Conchidium knighti}is a ribbed shell which can be founed in quarries on Mocktree, Shelderton and elsewhere. "knighti" perpetuates, in Latin, the name of one of the famous owners of Downton Castle. {Monograptus leintwardinensis}was named by Sir Roderick Murchison and preserves the name of the village where it was first found.
